title: Kaboomblah's tip of the day!
body:
I say this a bit tongue-in-cheek, because it's so basic but so overlooked.

Every other role may get a pass, but support players:

When your team sees you running around with a complete quest item and yellow trinket, it can be pretty tilting mentally.

replies.body:
if someone bought a relic shield and they have charges GO TO THAT PERSON so they can dump them and GIVE THEM THE LAST HITS
THEY BOUGHT THE ITEM FOR THE >>>TEAMS<<< GOLD EFFECIENCY, LET THEM LAST HIT TO USE HOWEVER MANY CHARGES THEY WANT MAKE SURE YOU GO TO THEM AND LET THEM LAST HIT WAVE (sometimes effective to dump all for power farming, but always want it to be active in cool down at least to some degree) and make sure you are there so they can pass off the teams gold effeciency and make their purchase not a waste of time/gold effeciency. Also if you are in a non conventional duo lane in a pub and they are kind enough to relic shield "sup" for you and they ask you to go relic shield as well so you can both get the gold you require fucking DO IT.{{champion:103}} {{champion:201}}

hey sometimes during a very fight based midgame, when you're trying to pressure your lead, the extra time you can stay without recalling to restock wards, makes it worth consideration. Admittedly though, overall it's generally just a mistake because you miss sightstone and didn't notice, although I'll argue that against bushstrat teams, red trinket is better than red sweeper because of the extra range.
But it also seems kinda dumb to exchange trinkets if you still have a ward in your trinket slot. Otherwise, you waste the ward, and end up with a 2min CD on a sweeper trinket, regardless.
